entry.title: Buzz Me When You Miss Me
entry.summary:
Author: S6a

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,898Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 77

Summary: It starts off as convenience.Then comfort.Then something else entirely.A quiet bracelet. A private signal.First Buck and Chris,then Buck and Eddie begin to speak without wordsjust soft pulses shared in silence,like Morse code for feelings neither of them are ready to say aloud.But silence has weight.And meaning.And sometimes, it says everything.¬†‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs this?‚Äù Chris asked quietly.Buck crouched down to his level. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve got the other one,‚Äù he said, showing the matching bracelet on his own wrist.‚ÄúIf you need me, just tap twice. No phone, no battery. Just... you and me.‚ÄùChris was silent for a moment, then slipped the bracelet on as if it had always belonged there.‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he asked.Buck‚Äôs voice was calm but firm. ‚ÄúBecause you tried to reach me. And I wasn‚Äôt there. That can‚Äôt happen again. Not with you.‚ÄùChris nodded. And then, without hurry, he stepped forward and hugged Buck again that week.No words. No rush. Just tight.

entry.title: I Don‚Äôt Think I‚Äôm Ever Gonna Figure It Out
entry.summary:
Author: folksongsinc

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,827Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 0

Summary: Three months after the birth of his nephew, Evan Buckley has a day off work so his sister suggests he spends some time with his nephew. However, tragic events occur on this day, and in response to this, Buck spirals downwards, coping with things like alcohol and cutting himself off from everyone in his life, until eventually he leaves the city, leaving nothing but a note the morning that he left, causing Eddie Diaz to also plummet downhill until he eventually realises he cannot cope without Buck in his life, leading him to go out looking for him.

entry.title: ocean blue.
entry.summary:
Author: kryptonian

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,372Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 78

Summary: "I am a soldier. Or I was, once."The mermaid confesses it like he‚Äôs ashamed, his voice quiet in Buck‚Äôs brain, softer than it‚Äôs been so far.‚ÄúNot anymore?‚Äù He asks, because how could he not? He has so many questions, ones that he‚Äôs not sure he‚Äôll even ever have the time to ask.Eddie didn‚Äôt answer right away. He simply looked at Buck, eyes dark and unreadable behind the distorted glass. Then he raised one hand and pressed his fingers against the barrier between them, the tips of them ghosting over the surface like he was remembering how it felt to touch something real. He tapped once. Then again.Tink, tink.The sound was delicate, but it echoed like a bell in Buck‚Äôs head.----tl;dr: mermaid eddie! firefighter buck! based on the art by @wrecked_fuse on twitter
